thread.title: Wellesley executive accused of embezzling $1 million - Massachusetts
thread.title_full: Wellesley executive accused of embezzling $1 million - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Wellesley executive accused of embezzling $1 million - Massachusetts
text:
A former executive at a Cambridge-based tech company was arrested by the FBI on Wednesday and charged with embezzling $1 million.
Andy Kim was charged with one count of wire fraud, and made his first appearance Wednesday afternoon in front of a U.S. District Court Magistrate according to an FBI press release .
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox Kim was fired in July. He joined the company in 2004 where he served as controller. That role gave him access to the firm’s checking account, said the FBI.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below “He allegedly disguised the transactions as transfers of capital to the company’s owner, fabricated records that purported to document legitimate capital transfers, and then planted those records in the company’s files,” said the FBI in a statement.
